005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.markup.MarkupMultiline;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathException;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathExpression;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.ISource;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.constraint.impl.DefaultLet;
013
014import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
018
019/**
020 * Represents a variable assignment for use in Metaschema module constraints.
021 */
022@SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortClassName")
023public interface ILet {
024  /**
025   * Create a new Let expression by compiling the provided Metapath expression
026   * string.
027   *
028   * @param name
029   *          the let expression variable name
030   * @param valueExpression
031   *          a Metapath expression string representing the variable value
032   * @param source
033   *          the source descriptor for the resource containing the constraint
034   * @param remarks
035   *          remarks about the let statement
036   * @return the original let statement with the same name or {@code null}
037   */
038  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortMethodName")
039  @NonNull
040  static ILet of(
041      @NonNull QName name,
042      @NonNull String valueExpression,
043      @NonNull ISource source,
044      @Nullable MarkupMultiline remarks) {
045    try {
046      return of(
047          name,
048          MetapathExpression.compile(valueExpression, source.getStaticContext()),
049          source,
050          remarks);
051    } catch (MetapathException ex) {
052      throw new MetapathException(
053          String.format("Unable to compile the let expression '%s=%s'%s. %s",
054              name,
055              valueExpression,
056              source.getSource() == null ? "" : " in " + source.getSource(),
057              ex.getMessage()),
058          ex);
059    }
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Create a new Let expression.
064   *
065   * @param name
066   *          the let expression variable name
067   * @param valueExpression
068   *          a Metapath expression representing the variable value
069   * @param source
070   *          the source descriptor for the resource containing the constraint
071   * @param remarks
072   *          remarks about the let statement
073   * @return the original let statement with the same name or {@code null}
074   */
075  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortMethodName")
076  @NonNull
077  static ILet of(
078      @NonNull QName name,
079      @NonNull MetapathExpression valueExpression,
080      @NonNull ISource source,
081      @Nullable MarkupMultiline remarks) {
082    return new DefaultLet(name, valueExpression, source, remarks);
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Get the name of the let variable.
087   *
088   * @return the name
089   */
090  @NonNull
091  QName getName();
092
093  /**
094   * Get the Metapath expression to use to query the value.
095   *
096   * @return the Metapath expression to use to query the value
097   */
098  @NonNull
099  MetapathExpression getValueExpression();
100
101  /**
102   * Information about the source resource containing the let statement.
103   *
104   * @return the source information
105   */
106  @NonNull
107  ISource getSource();
108
109  /**
110   * Get the remarks associated with the let statement.
111   *
112   * @return the remark or {@code null} if no remarks are defined
113   */
114  @Nullable
115  MarkupMultiline getRemarks();
116}
